message.content: Now I can see the issue clearly. The `createFeedWidget` function appends the widget to the DOM (line 409) but doesn't return anything, so it returns `undefined`. Let me fix this by modifying the function to return the created widget element:

function.name: str_replace_editor

args.new_str:
// Return the widget without appending it to the DOM
        return widget;
args.thought: Now I can see the issue clearly. The `createFeedWidget` function appends the widget to the DOM (line 409) but doesn't return anything, so it returns `undefined`. Let me fix this by modifying the function to return the created widget element:
